volume.name: New Kids On The Block: NKOTB

description:
In Volume Two, 'The Darkest Hour is Just Before Dawn,' America's spunkiest kid stands for fair play as she gives the scoundrels and rats their just desserts! Little Orphan Annie-the original female comics hero-takes on chiseling business men and a gang of thieves, armed only with her sharp wit and a good left hook. Then she helps her surrogate parents by nursing 'Daddy' Warbucks to health and helping save the Silos' family farm. And only that little chatter-box could become a cross between Robinson Crusoe and Dr. Doolittle when she and Sandy are shipwrecked on a deserted island. Enjoy all the unique adventure and earnest charm of Volume Two in The Library of American Comics presentation of Little Orphan Annie, containing nearly 1,000 comic strips from October 1927 to November 1930.

Daily and Sunday comics 1927-1929.
name: Volume Two: The Darkest Hour Is Just Before Dawn

volume.name: Edgar Rice Burroughs Tarzan of the Apes
Best of Betty and Veronica Summer Fun

description: Includes "We Challenge Joe Louis" by Abbott and Costello

name: Die Indianer: Die Ehre des Kriegers

description:
Leaving Home

Shacked in Merlin's dungeon, Mordred befriends Sir Aggravayne and instructs him to undermine his fellow Knights against one another. Arthur, finding no help from Merlin to interpret his dream of an invading army decides to leave Camelot and seek out the hermit Nacien.
name: Leaving Home

description: In search of Jacques Lassalle, Zagor Cico and Digging Bill venture into the mysterious continent of Africa. They meet slave traders, a mysterious artifact with dark powers, a friend believed to be dead ... And they discover that Jacques was kidnapped by the dreadful necromancers of Kush, who live in a cemetery city and have the power to awaken the dead.
name: Il ritorno di Cain

description: At the extreme border of Djouf lies the necropolis of Achron. It is there that, in distant times, king Thaylas of Kush brought the sceptre of the queen of Atlantis, Tin-Hinan. The search for the lost Lassalle interlaces with that of the mummy of Thaylas, who still holds in her hand the precious sceptre. It is under the authorty of this sceptre that Priness Marada wants to reunite the Tuareg tribes. But in the city of the dead, danger has the horrible aspect of the ghouls, the corpse eaters, while the comforting light of the sun shows Zagor and Cain the sheik Azim, with his Knights of the desert, is no less to be feared.
name: Atlantis

description: There is no end to the horrors that unfold before the eyes of Zagor, Cain and Princess Maradaâs Tuaregs. After a miraculous escape from the fury of the ghouls, their well-earned rest in the Gebel Shaat fortress is but short-lived: hordes of living dead are thronging against the walls, a spectral army composed of the corpses of all the soldiers whose bones have been bleached, century after century, by the scorching sun of the Djouf. Theyâre being guided by two Kushite priests, and this is the pair that must be struck down! Meanwhile, the search for Jacques Lassalle is still proceeding, with not only Zagor and Cico following his trail, but Captain Jean Lafitteâs bold and headstrong daughter Denise too, as well as the guardian angels Jerome and Van Sutter. For all of them, the quest leads to the legendary reign of Songhay and its magnificent queen, but not all of them get there by the same route. In fact, there are some, like poor Jerome, who will never set eyes on the majestic walls of the jungle city.
name: La fortezza nascosta

description:
According to legend, eating the lesh of a mermaid grants eternal youth and life. But living forever can be a blessing or a curse. And as two immortal lovers travel through Japan - and the centuries - longing for a normal existence, they learn that they are the lucky ones. Others who partake of the mermaid's flesh are transformed into savage lost souls...!

Mermaid Saga 1 contains three of Rumiko Takahashi's uniquely macabre mermaid tales: A Mermaid Never Smiles, The Village of the Fighting Fish, and the beginning of Mermaid Forest.

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter One: A Mermaid Never Smiles (Part One)
  • Chapter Two: A Mermaid Never Smiles (Part Two)
  • Chapter Three: The Village of the Fighting Fish (Part One)
  • Chapter Four: The Village of the Fighting Fish (Part Two)
  • Chapter Five: Mermaid Forest (Part One)
name: Volume 1

description:
A mysterious woman who knows the immortal lovers' secret holds Mana captive! Traveling through war-torn feudal Japan, Yuta must decide the fate of another unusual kind of immortal. Mana meets one of the Yuta's former lovers, who has became deranged with bitterness. And together, Yuta and Mana discover that evil lurks behind the most innocent of faces....

This volume contains the series Mermaid's Dream and Mermaid's Promise, and Mermaid's Scar.
name: Volume 2

description:
Partake of the Mermaid's Flesh, the Legend Says, and You Will be Granted Life Eternal. But When You Become Tired of Immortality, What Becomes of You? In this uniquely macabre tale by manga master Rumiko Takahashi, immortal lovers Yuta and Mana travel through Japan and the centuries encountering the best and worst in mankind and monster.

Mermaid's Gaze

Yuta knew the disturbing truth about the Kiyru mansion when he worked there over half a century ago. Now he and Mana are baout to discover the gloomy edifice's new, even more horrifying secret!
name: Volume 3

description:
Eating the flesh of a mermaid grants eternal life. But living forever can be a blessing or a curse. Immortal lovers Yuta and Mana are relatively lucky... others who partake of the mermaid's flesh are transformed into savage lost souls!

Yuta must confront his past when he and Mana discover the horrifying secret of the Kiryu mansion. Later, when the couple befriends a young boy, they become embroiled in a bizarre child custody fight.
name: Volume 4

description: This collection of tales, ranging from the macabre to heartwarming to wacky, will please any Takahashi fan, as well as introduce the uninitiated to the broad range of the manga master's work! Takahashi's first two comics ever, one of which won her Shogakukan Publishing's Best New Comic Artist Award. This volume contains the graphic novel Rumic World and the Rumic World installments from Manga Vizion Vol. 1, No. 7 and Vol. 1, No. 8.
name: Volume 1

description: Featuring the hilarious mini-series "Wasted Minds," a tale of two bumbling psychic secret agents. This volume contains the Rumic World installments from Manga Vizion Vol. 1, No. 9 through Vol. 2, No. 5.
name: Volume 2

description: A unique autobiographical story about Takahashi's action adventure as a cat sitter, plus 6 more tales! That Darn Cat: In This unique autobiographical story, Takahashi lives to tell and draw the tale of her very own action adventure as a cat stiler. Wedded Bliss: When a happily married couple are prevented by their neighbors from indulging in their daily ritual of lobbing dishes and smashing windows, they become walking pressure cookers. Sleep And Forgot: IIn This chilling taleof reincarnation, betrayal--and ultimate, love--a girl finds himself mysteriously drawn to a strange obsessed with dogs. Plus, A Cry For Help, War Council, When My Eyes Got Wings, and The Face Pack. This volume contains the Rumic World installments from Manga Vizion Vol. 2, No. 6 through No. 12.
name: Volume 3

description:
A talented boxer whose hunger for victory is eclipsed only by his ravenous appetite for hearty meals, Kosaku Hatanaka might have what it takes to be a true contender. Too bad his gluttonous gorging never fails to dash his hard-pressed coach's dreams of managing a champion. Can the virtuous (and really cute) Sister Angela, a novice nun with a soft spot for hard-luck cases, help steer Kosaku down the path to righteousness--and victory in the ring?!

Times are tough at Mukaida's Gym. Though a promising novice with a surprise win in his debut bout, Kosaku has since adopted a steady regimen of extremely unhealthy eating habits--enough to make his coach ready to permanently throw in the towel. Sister Angela hopes her teachings will help Kosaku see the error of his misguided ways. But will Kosaku's burgeoning feelings for the young nun undermine his ability to concentrate on training, fighting and binge eating?

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter One: The Sinner and the Scale Part One
  • Chapter One: The Sinner and the Scale Part Two
  • Chapter One: The Sinner and the Scale Part Three
  • Chapter Two: The Lamb On the Chopping Block Part One
  • Chapter Two: The Lamb On the Chopping Block Part Two
  • Chapter Two: The Lamb On the Chopping Block Part Three
  • Chapter Three: The Remains of Dreams Part One
  • Chapter Three: The Remains of Dreams Part Two
  • Chapter Three: The Remains of Dreams Part Three
  • Chapter Three: The Remains of Dreams Part Four
name: Volume 1

description:
Four years ago, Kosaku pulled off an astounding upset in his pro test by KO'ing a big-time boxer. More than simply sending his opponent down for the count, Kosaku also managed to mangle this pretty-boy fighter's teeth in the process. Now this toothless tyrant is ready for a rematch, but can Kosaku drop down an entire weight class to qualify for the bout? It is said that the weight of a fighter's punch comes down to how hard he grips his fist, but will Kosaku ever get a grip on his pre-fight snacking?

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter One: The Lamb Resurrected Part One
  • Chapter One: The Lamb Resurrected Part Two
  • Chapter One: The Lamb Resurrected Part Three
  • Chapter One: The Lamb Resurrected Part Four
  • Chapter One: The Lamb Resurrected Part Five
  • Chapter Two: The Lamb Who Crossed Himself Part One
  • Chapter Two: The Lamb Who Crossed Himself Part Two
  • Chapter Two: The Lamb Who Crossed Himself Part Three
  • Chapter Two: The Lamb Who Crossed Himself Part Four
  • Chapter Two: The Lamb Who Crossed Himself Part Five
name: Volume 2

description:
There's a new face around Mukaida's gym--a wannabe teenage pugilist who'll do anything to prove he's got what it takes to be a fighter... So why is he always sucker punching coach Mukaida? Can Kosaku bounce back from a bout with food poisoning in time to correct this young tough's bad attitude? Later, Kosaku strikes a bargain with Sister Angela. If he wins his next big eight-round fight, she'll agree to spend Christmas with him. Sounds simple enough, so why is the Mother Abbess forbidding Kosaku from punching his opponent's midsection? Could it have something to do with the Mexican fighter's religious tattoo?

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter One: Lamb For the Slaughter Part One
  • Chapter One: Lamb For the Slaughter Part Two
  • Chapter Two: Tears of A Lamb Part One
  • Chapter Two: Tears of A Lamb Part Two
  • Chapter Three: The Fallen Lamb Part One
  • Chapter Three: The Fallen Lamb Part Two
  • Chapter Three: The Fallen Lamb Part Three
  • Chapter Three: The Fallen Lamb Part Four
  • Chapter Three: The Fallen Lamb Part Five
name: Volume 3

description:
Final Volume!

While Kosaku's eternal struggle with his weight wages on, a meddling aunt tricks Sister Angela into paying a visit to her family, but is this all just a ruse to set the lovely sister up with an eligible young chef? Later, Kosaku's dedication is put to the ultimate test when he's given the option of pursuing a career in the restaurant business and retiring from the world of pugilism for good. And finally, Sister Angela's aunt outdoes herself by racking up an exorbitant bill at a host club and leaving her niece holding the bag. Kosaku vows to defend Angela's honor by challenging the dashing host to a title match, but will Angela defy the Mother Abbess and break her curfew to be at Kosaku's side? It's time for the final round to begin!

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter One: The Lamb's Restaurant Part One
  • Chapter One: The Lamb's Restaurant Part Two
  • Chapter Two: The Lamb's Plans For the Future Part One
  • Chapter Two: The Lamb's Plans For the Future Part Two
  • Chapter Three: The Lamb's Promise Part One
  • Chapter Three: The Lamb's Promise Part Two
  • Chapter Three: The Lamb's Promise Part Three
  • Chapter Three: The Lamb's Promise Part Four
  • Chapter Three: The Lamb's Promise Part Five
name: Volume 4

description: In Africa, and in the footsteps of Jacques Lassalle, Zagor reaches the edge of the ancient empire of Songhay. Here he is captured by the witch Marie Laveau, who manages to subdue making him believe to be the legendary demigod Damballah.
name: La regina della cittÃ  morta

description:
A secret Nazi base could be hidden in the ices of Antarctica!

Year 1946. The U.S. Navy sets up a huge expedition to Antarctica, known as âOperation Highjumpâ; it ends before the expected time, officially because of some accidents cause by the excessive cold. The goal of the mission is to do scientific researching in the Polar environment, but soon thereâs a rumor about a different objective: a secret Nazi base, that forced the members of the Highjump to a quick retreat. Fact or legend? The Detective of the Impossible investigates â and at the same time, he doesnât investigate â on one of the most disquieting mysteries he had to face in his career
name: Longitudine Zero

description: Reprint of issue #225 (The Little Princess).
name: Beyond The River Of Fire

description: You can read this issue for free via Dog Star Comics at http://www.dogstarcomics.com/free-webcomic-black-opus-vol-1/downloadview-black-opus-vol-1 (they call it "Black Opus")

This is it, the granddaddy of all epic events. Before Identity Crisis, Infinite Crisis, House of M, Civil War, and Infinity Gauntlet there was Secret Wars. A nigh omnipotent being from beyond has, for lack of a better word, kidnaped the greatest heroes and deadliest villains in the Marvel Universe and whisked them to the far side of the universe to battle for the ultimate prize. One thing is for certain, the lives of these heroes and villains will never be the same again. Starring the Avengers (Captain America, Thor, Wasp, Iron Man (James Rhodes), She Hulk, and Captain Marvel), the Fantastic Four (minus the Invisible Woman), X-Men (Professor X, Wolverine, Cyclops, Storm, Nightcrawler, Rogue, and Colossus), Magneto, Spider-Man, and the Incredible Hulk vs. Doctor Doom, Ultron, Absorbing Man, the Lizard, Molecule Man, Doctor Octopus, Kang the Conqueror, the Wrecking Crew, and the Enchantress.
name: Marvel Super Heroes Secret Wars TPB

volume.name: OPUS: 25 Years of His Sunday Best

description: Trapped far beneath Gotham City and hunted by the Talon - the Court of Owls' unstoppable killer - Batman lies bleeding and broken. With no way out and no one to help, is this the end for The Dark Knight?
name: Beneath the Glass
